data.title: Pop Culture, Comics, Pro Wrestling, Toys, TV, Movies, and Podcasts
data.meta_description: The Ultimate History of Pro Wrestling - 1934. Toys, TV, Movies, Music, Wrestling, Cartoons, Retro... #WhenItWasCool
data.meta_site_name: When It Was Cool - Pop Culture, Comics, Pro Wrestling, Toys, TV, Movies, and Podcasts
data.text:
Much of the text of this entry comes from issue 82 of the DragonKing Press Newsletter available as a downloadable .pdf in the digital downloads section.

The year 1934 is covered in the Long Form History of Pro Wrestling Podcast - Click Here.

1934

01-02-1934: The New York State Athletic Commission investigates Rudy Miller, Jack Curley, Jim Londos, Toots Mondt, Ed White, Tom Packs, and Dick Shikat on charges of fixing matches.

01-03-1934: Boston, MA: Arena: Promoter: Alex McLean: Attendance 10,000: Fred Moran battled Lieutenant O'Dell to a 10 minute draw… George Myerson defeats Gil Cross… Rebel Bob Russell defeats Al Peckham… Bull Curry battled George Saunders to a 15 minute draw… Boris Demetroff battled John Spellman to a 20 minute draw… Pat O'Hara defeats George Linnehan… World heavyweight champion Jim Londos defeats Charley Strack two falls to one.

01-08-1934: At Madison Square Garden in New York City, NY: Attendance: 8,000: World heavyweight champion Jim Browning defeated Ray Steele… Joe Savoldi defeated Sol Slagel… Carroll Pink Gardner defeated Paul Berlenbach… Hans Steinke defeated Benny Ginsberg… Gino Garibaldi battled Vic Christy to a draw… Hans Kampfer defeated Tiny Roebuck… Jagat Singh defeated Eli Fischer.

01-11-1934: Toronto, Canada: Maple Leaf Gardens: Attendance 8,500: George Hagen defeats Tommy Marvin… Sun Jennings wrestled Willie Davis to a 30 minute draw… Jim McMillen wrestled John Katan to a 30 minute draw… NWAssociation World Heavyweight champion Jim Londos defeats Rudy Dusek. Londos wins fall 1 and the next went to a time limit draw.

01-12-1934: In Detroit, MI: Attendance: 16,000: Jim Londos defeated Joe Stecher… George Zaharias defeated Jim Clinstock… Pat O'Shocker battled Karl Sarpolis to a draw… Cliff Olson defeated Lou Plummer.

Boston, MA: Boston Garden: Attendance 9,000: Fred Moran battled George Linnehan to a 10 minute draw… Vic Christy defeats Pat O'Hara… Hal Rumberg defeats Axel Anderson… Jules Strongbow defeats Al Peckham… Ernie Dusek defeats John Spellman… Casey Kazanjian defeats Hank Oswald… Earl McCready defeats Tiny Roebuck… Joe Malcewicz defeats Man Mountain Dean… AWA World champion Ed Don George defeats Joe Savoldi. The match began as 2/3 falls but after no falls were taken during the first hour the match became sudden death/first pinfall wins. There were no more falls until Ed Don George finally won the match after one hour, ten minutes and 11 seconds.

01-15-1934: Jack Pfeffer goes to the New York Times revealing several “inside secrets” about professional wrestling, specifically reporting that Jim Londos victory over Dick Shikat in 1929 was “prearranged.”

01-17-1934: Los Angeles, CA: Olympic Auditorium: 8,500: Jim Browning defeated Joe Savoldi by DQ after Savoldi used a drop kick which had been outlawed… Leo Numa defeated Pat Kelly… Nick Lutze defeated Bonnie Muir by referee decision… Dr. Fred Meyer wrestled Pat Fraley to a draw… Mike Mazurki wrestled Ivan Mannagoff to a draw… Cy Williams wrestled Jack Ganson to a draw.

01-22-1934: At Madison Square Garden in New York City, NY: Attendance: 5,000: Ed Don George defeated Jim McMillen… Ernie Dusek defeated Hans Steinke… Hans Kampfer defeated Man Mountain Dean… George Zaharias battled George Calza to a draw… Yussif Mahmout, Jr. defeated Jim Henry… Bert Rubi defeated Joe Campbell… Ray Steele defeated Paul Boesch… Gino Garibaldi defeated Sid Nabors… Dick Shikat defeated Harry Fields.

01-24-1934: Boston, MA: Boston Garden: Attendance 10,000: Hal Rumberg battled John Spellman to a ten minute draw… Jules Strongbow defeats Joe Doakes… Jim McMillen defeated Gene LeDoux… Gino Garibaldi defeats Pat O'Hara… Ray Steele defeats Harry Lundin…. Ernie Dusek battled Vic Christy to a 20 minute draw… Earl McCready defeats Casey Kazanjian… NWAssociation World Heavyweight champion Jim Londos defeats Joe Malcewicz by referee's decision after winning one fall and Malcewicz is injured and can not continue in the second.

Los Angeles, CA: Olympic Auditorium: Attendance 8,500: Cy Williams battled Pat Reilly to a 15 minute draw… Pat Fraley defeats Ad Herman… Sammy Stein defeats Rudy Skarda… Leo Numa defeats Nick Lutze by decision. Each man took a fall and the final was referee decision… NYSAC World champion Jim Browning defeats Joe Savoldi. Browning touring the west coast with the New York world wrestling title.

01-26-1934: The New York State Athletic Commission issues a ruling banning “syndicate agreements” between promoters and outlawing the dropkick.

In Detroit, MI: Attendance: 16,750: Jim Londos defeated Joe Stecher… Ray Steele battled Gino Garibaldi to a draw… Cliff Olson defeated Sol Slagel… Milo Steinborn defeated Jack Zarnas.

01-31-1934: Chicago, IL: Stadium: Attendance 20,200: Karl Davis defeats Dutch Hefner by DQ… Ernie Dusek defeats Matros Kirilenko… Joe Malcewicz defeats Milo Steinborn… Everett Marshall defeats Jim McMillen… NWAssociation World champion Jim Londos defeats Joe Savoldi.

02-02-1934: In St. Louis, MO: St Louis Arena: Attendance: 15,666: Abe Coleman defeated Dick Raines by count out… Ernie Dusek defeated Sol Slagel… Joe Malcewicz defeated Karl Sarpolis… World heavyweight champion Jim Londos defeated Gus Sonnenberg.

02-05-1934: At Madison Square Garden in New York City, NY: Attendance: 7,000: Jim Londos defeated Ernie Dusek… Sammy Stein defeated Stanley Pinto… Joe Savoldi defeated George Zarynoff… Yussif Mahmout, Jr. defeated Henry Piers… Hans Steinke battled George Zaharias to a draw… Ray Steele defeated Jagat Singh… Mayes McLain defeated Firpo Wilcox.

02-08-1934: Promoter John Krone dies of a heart attack in Chicago, IL.

02-09-1934: Philadelphia, PA: Convention Hall & Civic Center: Attendance: 17,000: Joe Malcewicz battled Joe Savoldi to a 30 minute draw… Vic Christy defeated Dick Raines… Ernie Dusek battled Harry Fields to a 30 minute draw… Youssef Mahmout defeated Charley Strack… Juan Humberto defeats Pat O'Hara… World heavyweight champion

Jim Londos defeated Everett Marshall in a match that lasted 3 HOURS, 4 Minutes and 45 seconds for a one fall match.

02-21-1934: Joe Stecher wrestles his last match before finally retiring for good against Jim Browning in Chicago, IL. Browning had grown up idolizing Stecher. Following Joe Stecher’s retirement he suffered from a variety of mental illnesses, most notably depression and was institutionalized and cared for by his brother, promoter Tony Stecher. Joe lived to be 80 years old.

02-25-1934: After wrestling a reported 80 minute match against Harry Kent in Kalispell, MT, The California Red Devil (Jack Lewis) dies of an apparent heart attack.

02-28-1934: Boston, MA: AWA World Heavyweight champion Ed Don George defeats Ernie Dusek by DQ in a match that lasted 2 hours, 18 minutes, and 50 seconds. Dusek won the first fall but was disqualified in the second. There was no third fall.

Los Angeles, CA: Olympic Auditorium: Attendance: 7,000: Jim Browning defeated Paul Jones… Dr. Fred Meyers wrestled Abie Kaplan to a draw… Leo Numa defeated Cy Williams… Mike Mazurki wrestled Pat Fraley to a draw… George Cochran defeated Pete Belcastro.

03-05-1934: Leroy McGuirk defeats Hugh Nichols for the World lightweight title in Tulsa, OK.

Hugh Winn defeats Fred Lassiter for the Atlanta City wrestling title.

03-07-1934: Los Angeles, CA: Olympic Auditorium: Attendance: 8,500: AWA World heavyweight champion Ed Don George defeated Dr. Fred Meyers… Leo Numa defeated Abie Kaplan… Paul Jones defeated George Cochrane… Nick Lutze wrestled Mike Mazurki to a draw… Vic Christy defeated Pat Fraley… Cy Williams wrestled Pat Riley to a draw.

03-11-1934: Tex Wright (28 years old) dies after a match with Harry Ekizian (wrestling at the time as Ali Yumid, later better known as Ali Baba) in Greeley, CO.

03-13-1934: Geoff Portz was born. Portz wrestled throughout the United States and Europe and is the father of pro wrestler Scott McGhee.

03-14-1934: From the Syracuse Herald: New York City: Jack Hurley, listed as one of the “bad men” in the professional wrestling game and instigator of near riots among spectators in Syracuse, Baltimore, Boston and other places at mat shows, met his death here early this morning in a fall from his room on the fourth floor of the Hotel Lenox, 149 West 44th Street. According to reports compiled by investigators, Hurley returned to the hotel at 3:30 o’clock, several hours after he had been thrown at the New York Coliseum by Emil Dusek, 205-pound wrestler of Omaha, Neb. The body was found, fully clad, some time later in a courtyard in the rear of the hotel.

Tony Felice, another wrestler residing at the hotel, declared Hurley, while he had improved rapidly since entering the professional mat sport and was regarded as a coming star, had tired of the grappling work and intended to quit shortly and go into business with his father. Hurley, standing well over six feet, weighed 215 pounds and was extremely proud of his ability to incite the fans. He was placed on a Syracuse mat card last fall when the Disabled War Veterans decided to sponsor professional wrestling and made such a hit on his first appearance that he was brought back several times for repeat performances.

Hurley also was “built up” in the Boston area and drew out the customers in Baltimore, Rochester and other cities on the mat chain whenever he was billed with a rough and ready foe. Strangely enough, Emil Dusek, who defeated Hurley in his final ring encounter, is scheduled to show in Syracuse on Wednesday, March 21, to oppose Joe Savoldi, the ex-Notre Dame football star, in the main bout of a card rigged up by John Contos, Baltimore promoter. Police notified Hurley’s mother, Mrs. J.B. Hurley, Belmar, N.J., and his widow, who resides at 317 West 84th Street, New York City.

03-19-1934: At Madison Square Garden in New York City, NY: Attendance: 7,000: World heavyweight champion Jim Browning defeated Hans Kampfer… Henri Deglane defeated Tiny Roebuck… Jim McMillen defeated Mayes McLain… Sandor Szabo defeated Fred Carone… Joe Savoldi defeated Bert Rubi… Sammy Stein defeated Rudy Dusek… Abe Coleman battled Sam Cordovano to a draw.

03-23-1934: In Detroit, MI. Attendance: 12,000: Jim Londos defeated Ray Steele by decision… George Zaharias defeated Tiny Roebuck… Gino Garibaldi defeated Dick Raines… Cliff Olson battled Charley Strack to a draw.

04-07-1934: In Cincinnati, OH: An ordinance to regulate wrestling in Cincinnati was reported in city hall circles today, following announcement that Jack Reynolds, recognized as welterweight mat champion, would defend his title next Friday night. Reynolds' wife, Alice Martin Reynolds, is under a charge of murder as a result of the fatal shooting, several weeks ago, in a cafe of James Meyers, Cincinnati politician, and Philip Citron, also of Cincinnati. Pending report of a grand jury in the case, Mrs. Reynolds was freed on $15,000 bond to permit treatment of an illness. Police have said that Reynolds was owner of a gun that figured in the affray. Safety director Fred K. Hoehler is on record against the scheduled bout, and has voiced opposition to other matches in which Reynolds has participated.

04-11-1934: Cincinnati, OH: There will be no championship welterweight wrestling match between Jack Reynolds, claimant of the title, and Pat Finnegan of Springfield, Ohio. The Ohio division of the National Wrestling Association announced that Reynolds will be barred from participating in bouts here until after an investigation of a shooting in which two persons were killed. Reynolds' wife and David Polinsky are charged with murder.

St. Louis, MO: St Louis Arena: Attendance: 11,727: Charley Strack defeats Milo Steinborn… Orville Brown defeats George Zaharias… Ray Steele defeats Pete Schuh… World heavyweight champion Jim Londos defeated Dick Shikat.

Los Angeles, CA: Olympic Auditorium: Attendance: 7,500: World heavyweight champion Jim Browning defeated Leo Numa… Dick Daviscourt defeated Everett Kibbons… Ed “Strangler” Lewis defeated Mike Mazurki… Vic Christy defeated Joe Varga… Harold Jacobs defeated Chuck Stingari.

04-12-1934: Former World middleweight champion Jack Reynolds is indicted by an Ohio Grand Jury in the death of James Meyers and Philip Citron in a Cincinnati murder in March. Reynolds is acquitted in the trial.

In Mexico City, Mexico at Arena Peralvillo-Cozumel: Tarzan Lopez makes his pro debut under the name Carlos Lopez defeating Enrique Gonzalez.

04-15-1934: Mexico City, Mexico: El Toreo Stadium: Attendance 12.000: Carlos Meza battled Diablo Lopez to a draw… Mario Nunez defeats Tony Canales… Pietro Belcastro defeats Tex Wright… Ruddy Skarda defeats Manuel Hernandez… NYSAC World Heavyweight champion Jim Browning defeated Ed “Strangler: Lewis 2 falls to 1.

04-18-1934: Los Angeles, CA: Olympic Auditorium: Attendance: 5,000: World heavyweight champion Jim Browning defeated Dick Daviscourt 2 out of 3 falls… Leo Numa defeated Jack Zarnos by count out… Ed “Strangler” Lewis defeated Jack Ray… Count George Zaranoff defeated Mike Mazurki… Vic Christy wrestled Paul Jones to a draw.

04-24-1934: Lou Thesz wins his first match defeating Ben Bailey in St. Louis, MO.

Detroit, MI: Olympia: Attendance 8,235: Ernie Peterson battled Frank Malcewicz to a 20 minute draw… Frank Sexton defeats Pat McClary… Bill Keif battled Jimmy Hefner to a 30 minute draw… John Swenski defeats Alex Kasaboski… Ali Baba (Harry Ekizian) defeats World heavyweight champion Dick Shikat to win the championship.

04-25-1934: Los Angeles, CA: Olympic Auditorium: Attendance: 6,500: World heavyweight champion Jim Browning defeated Dick Daviscourt in 2 falls… Leo Numa wrestled Count George Zaranoff to a draw… Jack Zarnos defeated Jack Manuel… Paul Jones defeated Cy Williams… Hank Oswald defeated Jack Ganson via DQ.

04-27-1934: Philadelphia, PA: Arena: Attendance 9,000: Harry Fields defeats Luigi Bacigalupi… Ernie Zeller battled Len Macaluso to a draw… Earl McCready battled Ray Steele to a 30 minute draw… Joe Savoldi defeats Abe Coleman… World Heavyweight champion Jim Londos defeats Gus Sonnenberg by DQ.

04-30-1934: At Madison Square Garden in New York City, NY: Attendance: 3,000: NYSAC World heavyweight champion Jim Browning defeated Ray Steele… Gus Sonnenberg defeated Man Mountain Dean… Joe Savoldi defeated George Hagen… Willie Davis battled Harry Fields to a draw… Hans Kampfer battled Rudy Dusek to a draw… Marshall Blackstock defeated Doug Wykoff… Abe Coleman defeated Bert Rubi.

05-07-1934: At Madison Square Garden in New York City, NY: Attendance: 4,000: Jim Londos defeated Joe Savoldi by count out… Henri Deglane battled Jim McMillen to a draw… Gus Sonnenberg defeated Willie Davis… Hans Kampfer defeated Mayes McLain… Rudy Dusek defeated Joe “Bull” Komar… Abe Coleman defeated Ted Christy by DQ.

05-16-1934: St. Louis, MO: St Louis Arena: Attendance: 10,138: Hans Kaempfer defeats Joe Cox… George Zaharias defeats Matros Kirilenko… Orville Brown battled Ray Steele to a 30 minute draw… NWAssociation World heavyweight champion Jim Londos defeated Dick Shikat.

05-18-1934: Boston, MA: Boston Garden: Attendance 14,000: Billy Bartush battled Bull Martin to a 10 minute draw… John Spellman defeats Jules Strongbow… Pat O'Hara defeats Stanley Stickney… Karl Pojello defeats Boris Dimitroff… Hardy Kruskamp defeats Harry Lewis… Hans Steinke defeats Earl McCready… Jim McMillen battled Nick Lutze to a 30 minute draw… Henri Deglane defeats Man Mountain Dean… AWA World champion Ed Don George defeats Ernie Dusek 2 falls to 1.

05-23-1934: Los Angeles, CA: Olympic Auditorium: Attendance: 5,000: Count George Zaranoff defeated Dick Daviscourt… Jack Ganson defeated George Wilson via KO… Ivan Managoff wrestled Jack Donovan to a draw… Jack Smith defeated Hank Oswald… Paul Jones defeated Pete Shoe by DQ.

05-25-1934: Philadelphia, PA: Convention Hall: Attendance 12,000: Len Macaluso defeats Buck Weaver… Earl McCready defeats Dick Raines… Jim McMillen defeats Ernie Zeller… Hans Kaempfer battled Henri Deglane to a 30 minute draw… World heavyweight champion Jim Londos defeats Gus Sonnenberg in a rematch from April 27.

05-30-1934: In Cincinnati, OH: A jury having accepted the defense's contention that "fate decreed that the killers kill each other," Jack Reynolds, NWA. welterweight champion, today stood acquitted of a murder charge. It took the jury less than two hours last night to decide that the wrestler and two co-defendants were not guilty of shooting to death James Meyers, 52, in a cafe brawl in the early morning of March 11. Reynolds, his wife Alice, and a friend, David Polinsky, 28, were charged with second-degree murder. Although Polinsky admitted he fired at Meyers, the defense maintained it was in self-defense, and defense attorneys contended his bullet did not kill Meyers. Defense counsel argued also that "full justice" already had been done, holding Meyers and Citron killed each other. All three defendants wept freely as they thanked the jury and accepted the congratulations of friends.

Who is When It Was Cool?

When It Was Cool is a family run website operated by the husband & wife duo of Karl & Tonya but supported by an incredible team of content providers. We are a retro pop culture podcast network and website.

Karl (AKA: DragonKingKarl from Wrestling Observer & Figure Four Online) is a long time pro wrestling historian and author. He and his wife love retro TV, movies, classic rock, comics, toys, dolls, and anything old school.

Joined by an eclectic group of pop culture podcast providers, we present a family friendly, work safe, podcasting network that includes shows on heavy metal music, comic books, pro wrestling, retro pop culture, Americana, science & society, and our flagship podcast is the When It Was Cool Podcast.

If you are interested in putting your podcast on the When It Was Cool Podcast Network please see our Patreon page for information but remember- it must be work safe and family friendly!
